description.plain:
DNCE is an American band that consists of lead singer Joe Jonas, drummer Jack Lawless, and guitarist JinJoo Lee. From when the band started in 2015 to when it went on hiatus after 2018 ended, bassist and keyboardist Cole Whittle was in it.

On September 11, 2015, Jonas announced the existence of DNCE through social media. Exactly a week later, the band released their debut single, “Cake by the Ocean,” which reached the top ten on the charts in various countries. The song served as the lead single from their debut extended play, SWAAY, which was released on October 23, 2015.

DNCE released their self-titled debut studio album on November 18, 2016. It was supported by the lead single, “Body Moves,” which was released on September 30, 2016. Three out of four songs from SWAAY were also included: “Cake by the Ocean,” “Toothbrush,” and “Pay My Rent.” “Jinx” from the EP is included on the jumbo edition, which was released only in Japan on November 8, 2017.

On June 15, 2018, DNCE released their second extended play, People to People. It was the last project they released before they went on hiatus in 2018, as Jonas and Lawless resumed work with the Jonas Brothers, Jonas' other band with his brothers, Nick and Kevin, when they reunited after more than a five-year-hiatus in February 2019. It was also the last project they released with Whittle in the band, as he focused on his solo career after the hiatus ended almost four years.

DNCE announced its comeback from their hiatus on February 7, 2022. Jonas was also interviewed by Rolling Stone on the same day, in which he announced Whittle’s departure from the band and discussed the band’s future. The band was also featured on Kygo’s single, “Dancing Feet,” which served as their comeback single and was released on February 25, 2022. After that, they released the singles “Move” and “Got Me Good,” two potential singles from their upcoming second studio album.

body.plain:
DNCE is an American band that consists of lead singer Joe Jonas, drummer Jack Lawless, and guitarist JinJoo Lee. From when the band started in 2015 to when it went on hiatus after 2018 ended, bassist and keyboardist Cole Whittle was in it.

On September 11, 2015, Jonas announced the existence of DNCE through social media. Exactly a week later, the band released their debut single, “Cake by the Ocean,” which reached the top ten on the charts in various countries. The song served as the lead single from their debut extended play, SWAAY, which was released on October 23, 2015.

DNCE released their self-titled debut studio album on November 18, 2016. It was supported by the lead single, “Body Moves,” which was released on September 30, 2016. Three out of four songs from SWAAY were also included: “Cake by the Ocean,” “Toothbrush,” and “Pay My Rent.” “Jinx” from the EP is included on the jumbo edition, which was released only in Japan on November 8, 2017.

On June 15, 2018, DNCE released their second extended play, People to People. It was the last project they released before they went on hiatus in 2018, as Jonas and Lawless resumed work with the Jonas Brothers, Jonas' other band with his brothers, Nick and Kevin, when they reunited after more than a five-year-hiatus in February 2019. It was also the last project they released with Whittle in the band, as he focused on his solo career after the hiatus ended almost four years.

DNCE announced its comeback from their hiatus on February 7, 2022. Jonas was also interviewed by Rolling Stone on the same day, in which he announced Whittle’s departure from the band and discussed the band’s future. The band was also featured on Kygo’s single, “Dancing Feet,” which served as their comeback single and was released on February 25, 2022. After that, they released the singles “Move” and “Got Me Good,” two potential singles from their upcoming second studio album.

songs.full_title: Cake by the Ocean by DNCE
songs.title: Cake by the Ocean

description.plain:
“Cake by the Ocean” is the debut single by DNCE. The song appears on two projects: it serves as the lead single from the band’s debut extended play, SWAAY, which was released in October 2015, and also appears on their self-titled debut studio album, which was released in November 2016.

The track was first premiered on New York radio station Z100 and on Complex on September 14, 2015.

Jonas told Complex the track was “a total breakthrough” for the band, propelling the “offbeat pop project,” while Complex called it “one part swagging 70’s, one part buttery R&B.” The track’s title was a quote said by producers Mattman & Robin, who were actually referring to the drink “Sex on the Beach”.

The song includes playful lyrics from DNCE’s lead singer, Joe Jonas, who sings about getting wild in a romantic relationship by making cake-related references, as “cake” could be used as slang for the sexually-charged lyrics that he croons. The other members of the band include JinJoo Lee on the guitar, Cole Whittle on the bass and keyboards, and Jack Lawless on the drums, who are involved alongside Mattman & Robin in providing Joe with a dance-pop and funk-pop style.

songs.embed_content: Read “Cake by the Ocean” by DNCE on Genius

songs.full_title: Kissing Strangers by DNCE (Ft. Nicki Minaj)
songs.title: Kissing Strangers

description.plain:
DNCE team up with rapper Nicki Minaj on their first new song after the release of their self titled debut album. The song is produced by the Swedish duo Mattman & Robin, who also produced DNCE’s hit single “Cake By The Ocean”.

The video for “Kissing Strangers” has already been shot and features a Western-themed aesthetic.

We don't need to keep it hush
You could leave a toothbrush at my place, at my place

Up in the mornin', uh, tangled in sheets
We play the moment on repeat, on repeat (Ah-woo)
[Pre-Chorus]
When you're standing there in your underwear
And my t-shirt from the night before
With your messed-up hair and your feet still bare
Would you mind closing the bedroom door? (Ah-woo)

[Chorus]
Baby, you don't have to rush
You can leave a toothbrush at my place, at my place
We don't need to keep it hush
You could leave a toothbrush at my place, at my place

I just, I just can't let you go here
Give me somethin' I've never known (Ah-woo)
So, baby, you don't have to rush
You could leave a toothbrush at my place (Come on), at my place

[Verse 2]
No need to question next time we meet
I know you're comin' home with me, home with me (Ah-woo)
Sweat like a sauna, uh, break out the ice
I know you're gonna stay the night, stay the night (Ah-woo)

[Pre-Chorus]
When you're standing there in your underwear
And my t-shirt from the night before
With your messed-up hair and your feet still bare
Would you mind closing the bedroom door? (Ah-woo, hey)
You might also like[Chorus]
Baby, you don't have to rush
You can leave a toothbrush at my place, at my place
We don't need to keep it hush
You could leave a toothbrush at my place, at my place (Woo)

[Post-Chorus]
I just, I just can't let you go here
Give me somethin' I've never known (Ah-woo, hey)
So, baby, you don't have to rush (Haha)
You could leave a toothbrush at my place (Haha, ha), at my place

[Bridge]
'Cause I don't want this to end
And there's no need to play pretend
If you stay with me again
Would you mind closing the bedroom door? (Ah-woo)

[Chorus]
Baby, you don't have to rush (You don't have to rush, oh)
You can leave a toothbrush at my place, at my place
We don't need to keep it hush (Keep it, oh)
You could leave a toothbrush at (Hey), my place, at my place

[Post-Chorus]
I just, I just can't let you go here (No, no)
Give me somethin' I've never known (Give me somethin' I've never known, ah-woo)
So, baby, you don't have to rush
You could leave a toothbrush at my place (At my place), at my place23Embed
